title: Fedra Sans is April issue of HOW magazine
content: Just thought you would like to know that there is a little snippet about Bil'ak's Fedra Sans and his Typotheque foundry in this month's issue of HOW. Nothing to rush out and by the magazine for, but it's there.
author: kraftie

comments.content: er "is" = "in," in the topic that is.

For those interested, the article is on page 24 of the June 2002 issue of How.   
   
David
thanks for the correction, i think im having a case of the mondays, regardless of what day of the week it actually is.

:D Heh heh.... No problem. Wasn't a correction as much as an addendum of information. ;)   
   
Fedra's on my wish list of new fonts to get. Thanks for the tip!   
   
David

Guys, I found nothing in the June issue.   
   
hhp

How Magazine (Design Ideas at Work)   
   
June 2002   
   
Special Issue: Designer's Guide to Creativity   
("49 Ways to Spark Your Creativity", with the   
happy spark plug on the cover ![:)](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022113915im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif) )   
   
Page 24, bottom half of the first column,   
   
"Typographic Double Whammy"   
   
I missed it too, the first few times I flipped   
through looking for it.   
   
It's very short: only 3 paragraphs and an   
information line, with short line-specimens of   
Fedra Sans Light, Book, Normal, Medium and Bold.   
   
David
